instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan spinning,no chime,black screen
threads.message:
had a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board,status as below

Machine has no water damage history
machine was fully functioning (our own board actually),used to test on another machine.
One junior came,take the board,put into one machine which has history of water damage,can't turn on but all corroded part replaced / cleaned properly
fan spin,display was there,suddenly turn to black,and when turn off,and on again,still black,and when open the bottom cover,unplug battery,plug in charger,notice the fan can spin when its on but still no display and no chime
status of this board :

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> at pin 5 <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL> pin 2 <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL> pin 2 <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = 16.22v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> pin 13 <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> = 3.404v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> pin 1 <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> = 3.331v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pin 29 <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>= 5.15v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> pin 2 <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> = 5.16v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> pin 6 <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> = 5.14v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> pin 2 <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> = 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> pin 4 <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> = 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> pin 8 <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> =3.31v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR> =3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5361</RESISTOR> = 3.330v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> = 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FET</SIGNAL> pin 6 <CHIP>U8070</CHIP> = 3.331V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBT</SIGNAL> pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C2951</CAPACITOR> = 3.326v
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR</SIGNAL> pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C1060</CAPACITOR>= 1.358V
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL> pin 2 <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> = 1.359V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> pin 1 <RESISTOR>R1890</RESISTOR> =1.038V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> pin 2 L7870 =1.51V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> pin 4 <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>=1.043V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL> pin 1 L1290 = 1.038V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> pin 2 L7320 =1.74V

any other rail that i should check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan spinning,no chime,black screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan spinning,no chime,black screen
threads.message: Remove SSD and reset PRAM. Got a light on the USB mouse? Picture on external?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan spinning,no chime,black screen
threads.message:
did PRAM,nothing,even backlight also doesnt turn on.
removed everything except fan and i/o magsafe,fan spinning,plug in usb mouse (cable) no light,put usb drive,got 1 time led blink and none after that.when measure the pin,power rail got 5.1v,the 2 middle pin got some mv,around 2mv/2.4mv.....last pin ground got 0.01mv
CPU is hot but not overheat.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan spinning,no chime,black screen
threads.message: Could be anything. Probably knocked off a component somewhere or ESD damage. Inspect for damaged/missing components.
